**Organization**: The organization name can be found in the URL (e.g https://ORGANIZATION_NAME.zendesk.com).

**API Token**: You can find this in the Zendesk Admin Panel under Settings > APIs > Zendesk API.

Triggers when a new ticket is created in: Triggers when a new ticket is created in a view
Fires when a new ticket is created (opti: Fires when a new ticket is created (optionally filtered by organization). Requires a Zendesk Trigger with Notify active webhook.
Fires when an existing ticket is updated: Fires when an existing ticket is updated. Requires a Zendesk Trigger with Notify active webhook.
Fires when a ticket update includes the: Fires when a ticket update includes the specified tag. Requires a Zendesk Trigger with Notify active webhook.
Fires when a new organization record is: Fires when a new organization record is created. Uses Zendesk event webhook (no Trigger needed).
Fires when a new user is created. Uses Z: Fires when a new user is created. Uses Zendesk event webhook (no Trigger needed).
Fires when a ticket is suspended. Requir: Fires when a ticket is suspended. Requires a Zendesk Trigger with Notify active webhook. Suspended tickets auto-delete after 14 days.
Fires when the specified ticket updates. Requires a Zendesk Trigger with Notify active webhook.
The view to monitor for new tickets: The view to monitor for new tickets
Filter tickets by organization. Leave em: Filter tickets by organization. Leave empty to trigger for all organizations.
Only trigger when this specific tag is a: Only trigger when this specific tag is added. Leave empty to trigger for any tag addition.
Filter users by role. Leave empty to tri: Filter users by role. Leave empty to trigger for all user types.
Only trigger for tickets from this organ: Only trigger for tickets from this organization ID. Leave empty for all organizations.
The specific ticket ID to monitor for ac: The specific ticket ID to monitor for actions/events.
